description: Consider primes p with least positive primitive root g such that q=p+g is next prime after p; sequence gives values of g.
references: M. Abramowitz and I. A. Stegun, eds., Handbook of Mathematical Functions, National Bureau of Standards Applied Math. Series 55, 1964 (and various reprintings), p. 864.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..1000
M. Abramowitz and I. A. Stegun, eds., Handbook of Mathematical Functions, National Bureau of Standards, Applied Math. Series 55, Tenth Printing, 1972 [alternative scanned copy].
Index entries for primes by primitive root
example: 11 has primitive root 2 and 11+2 = 13 is prime after 11, which contributes a 2 to the sequence.
mathematica: f[p_] := {g = PrimitiveRoot[p], p + g == NextPrime[p]};A047935 = Select[f /@ Prime /@ Range[1000], #[[2]]& ][[All, 1]](* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Feb 15 2012 *)
author: _Felice Russo_
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Dec 22 1999
